pr_title: HBASE-24335 Support deleteall with ts but without column in shell mode

timeline.message: HBASE-24335 Support deleteall with ts but without column in shell mode

timeline.bodyText: nit: better rephrase comment as: //'' means no specific column
timeline.author: wchevreuil
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -30,12 +30,14 @@ def help
   hbase> deleteall 't1', 'r1'
   hbase> deleteall 't1', 'r1', 'c1'
   hbase> deleteall 't1', 'r1', 'c1', ts1
+  hbase> deleteall 't1', 'r1', '', ts1        //'' means not specify column

replies.bodyText: Maybe worth also explain that this command deletes all cells in the row which timestamp is lower than the one specified in the command.
replies.author: wchevreuil

timeline.bodyText: should be it deletes or will delete, instead of  it will deletes.
timeline.author: wchevreuil
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -30,12 +30,16 @@ def help
   hbase> deleteall 't1', 'r1'
   hbase> deleteall 't1', 'r1', 'c1'
   hbase> deleteall 't1', 'r1', 'c1', ts1
+  //'' means no specific column, it will deletes all cells in the row which timestamp is lower than

replies.bodyText: fix, thanks for the review and patience.  : )
replies.author: bsglz

timeline.bodyText:
Sorry for being pedant, still has an english grammar error. Should be:

//'' means no specific column, will delete all cells in the row which timestamp is lower than
timeline.author: wchevreuil
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -30,12 +30,16 @@ def help
   hbase> deleteall 't1', 'r1'
   hbase> deleteall 't1', 'r1', 'c1'
   hbase> deleteall 't1', 'r1', 'c1', ts1
+  //'' means no specific column, will deletes all cells in the row which timestamp is lower than
